content:
advertisement

Students studying abroad now have more resources to fend off feeling like a tourist in a foreign country while having the opportunity to build their resumes PERIOD

Caf Abroad a social networking Web site and magazine for study abroad students hired Jessica Choromanski seniorsupply chain and information systems last December for a managerial role as she studied abroad in Sydney Australia PERIOD She said the Web site was not completed until July but she worked with founder Dan Schwartzman Class of  during the semester to set up the Sydney page and complete the city guide PERIOD

 Choromanski said PERIOD 

Caf Abroad offers internship opportunities with the company for college students traveling abroad Schwartzman said PERIOD The positions available are travel journalists regional managers and regional representatives PERIOD

Former study abroad students Schwartzman and Mark Travers a Cornell University alumnus released the magazine Caf Abroad InPRINT earlier this year PERIOD They came up with the idea after sharing their overseas experiences with one another while working at a small newspaper in New Jersey PERIOD Schwartzman studied in Brisbane Australia in  and Travers studied in Barcelona and Madrid before graduating in  PERIOD

The magazine features original photographs and firsthand accounts of students experiences while studying abroad PERIOD All of the magazines content is studentgenerated Schwartzman said who also serves as the magazines managing editor PERIOD

 Schwartzman said PERIOD 

Caf Abroad InPRINT was first published in March and is now distributed to more than  universities nationwide Schwartzman said PERIOD

 he said PERIOD 

The magazines online counterpart Cafeabroad.com was launched in September and is meant to be a social networking site with a focus on journalism Schwartzman said PERIOD

Caf Abroad can help study abroad students interact with each other he said PERIOD

 Schwartzman said PERIOD 

Studying abroad is a great experience for all students Choromanski said PERIOD

 she said PERIOD 

Jamison Morse seniorarchitectural engineering completed an architecture minor in Rome Italy last summer PERIOD

Morse said he would have used Caf Abroads resources if he had known about it PERIOD

 Morse said PERIOD

Schwartzman said Caf Abroad representatives will visit Penn State sometime this fall but the exact date has not yet been determined PERIOD

Copies of Caf Abroad are available at the Education Abroad office in  Boucke Building PERIOD The next issue is due out Nov PERIOD  PERIOD
